description: From Middle French regaigner (French regagner). Surface etymology is re- +â€Ž gain.

entries.meaning: The act or process of regaining something.
(textiles) The amount of width a woven cloth grows by when the fibers swell, used to determine the width of the reed to use in weaving.

verbs.description: regain (third-person singular simple present regains, present participle regaining, simple past and past participle regained)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To get back; to recover possession of.
